summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors on July 6, 2019, discussing edits to a draft detention memorandum for Jeffrey Epstein. The emails include suggestions for precise legal language regarding the 2007 non-prosecution agreement, Epstein's status as a sex offender, and confirmation that a search warrant was signed and a flight manifest for Epstein's plane was received.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Signed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding investigations into the abuse of minor girls in the Palm Beach area.

events.title: Search Warrant Signed
events.description: Judge Moses signed a search warrant related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Flight Manifest Received
events.description: The FBI received a flight manifest from Customs and Border Protection (CBP) listing Epstein and two pilots as passengers on a flight, with plans to confirm after takeoff.

events.title: Epstein's Statement on His Offense
events.description: A referenced NY Post article quotes Epstein stating, "I'm not a sexual predator, I'm an offender. It's the difference between a murderer and a person who steals a bagel," suggesting a lack of appreciation for the gravity of his crimes.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were carefully drafting a detention memorandum for Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019, focusing on precise legal language about the 2007 non-prosecution agreement and his risk of re-offense.
The 2007 non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida explicitly identified investigations into Epstein's abuse of minor girls in the Palm Beach area.
A search warrant was signed by Judge Moses on July 6, 2019, and the FBI received a flight manifest for Epstein's plane listing him and two pilots as passengers.
Prosecutors considered citing a 2011 statement by Epstein where he minimized his crimes, comparing himself to a 'person who steals a bagel' rather than a sexual predator.
The email chain shows coordination among SDNY prosecutors Geoffrey Berman, Laura Birger, Craig Stewart, and Audrey Strauss in the lead-up to Epstein's arrest.
